intro: Gnaphalium heteranthum, commonly known as the hairy ragwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually hairy and serrated, while the flowers are small and yellowish-green. Gnaphalium heteranthum produces a fine, aromatic resin that can be used in traditional medicine.
